Detailed Description

All common used ATMI method are group in this class.

Author:
Herbert Koelman

Member Function Documentation

int atmi::Tuxedo::abort ( )

Abort XA transaction.

Return: Upon failure an TransactionException is raised.

char* atmi::Tuxedo::allocate ( char *  type,
char *  subtype,
long  size 
)

Allocate a new buffer of type. Depending on the type both subtype and len are optional.

Buffer types provided by Tuxedo CARRAY Character array (possibly containing NULL characters) that is neither encoded nor decoded during transmission STRING NULL-terminated character array FML FML fielded buffer VIEW C structure or FML view X_OCTET Equivalent to CARRAY; provided for XATMI compatibility X_C_TYPE Equivalent to VIEW; provided for XATMI compatibility X_ COMMON Equivalent to VIEW; provided for XATMI compatibility FML32 FML32 fielded buffer, using 32-bit identifiers and offsets VIEW32 C structure or FML32 view, using 32-bit identifiers, counter variables, and size variables XML Buffer for XML documents MBSTRING Character array for multibyte characters

Note that only the first eight bytes of type and the first 16 bytes of subtype are significant.

Parameters:
typebuffer type to allocate (STRING, VIEW, FML, ...)
subtypebuffer subtype. NULL means none
sizememory size to allocate.
Returns:
allocated buffer or NULL if failed
Exceptions:
TuxedotExceptionif something goes wrong.
int atmi::Tuxedo::begin ( int  timeout = 0)

Starts an XA transaction.

Parameters:
timeoutmax duration in seconds for a transaction to complete.
Exceptions:
TransactionExceptionis raised upon failure.
int atmi::Tuxedo::commit ( )

Commit XA transaction

Exceptions:
TransactionExceptionon failure.
char* atmi::Tuxedo::extend ( char *  buffer,
long  extent 
)

Routine to change the size of a typed buffer.

Parameters:
bufferthe buffer to resize (the return value maybe different)
extentnumber of bytes to add
Returns:
reference to resized buffer

void atmi::Tuxedo::set_context ( TPCONTEXT_T  c) [inline]

set the Tuxedo context to use when calling Tuxedo functions.

When set, ATMI++ switches to this context (()@ ) before executing a Tuxedo call.

Parameters:
ccontext to be used by this instance
void atmi::Tuxedo::setFlags ( long  flags) [inline]
void atmi::Tuxedo::switch_context ( ) [protected]

If context is set (context != 0 ), then tpsetctxt is called. This method does nothing otherwise.
